title: Senior Staff Resists New Protocol
summary: A long-time staff member openly resists a new sterilization protocol. Preserve dignity while reinforcing standards: speak privately, understand concern, then reinforce or involve them in rollout.

scene.setting: A long-time staff member openly resists a new sterilization protocol. You may feel irritated or threatened; the hidden risk is forcing compliance publicly and losing influence. The decision point is assert authority vs preserve dignity while reinforcing standards.

beats.narration: The resistance is visible. The decision point is correct publicly or speak privately first.

dialogue.speaker: lead
dialogue.line: I want to understand your concern—and the standard isn't optional. Can we talk privately?

choices.label: Correct them in front of the team and insist on compliance.

steps.step: Private conversation: understand concern; focus on protocol not person; reinforce standard.

leader_lines: Public wasn't the right place. Let's talk privately—what's the concern? The standard stays.
How do we reinforce without shaming?
scripts.closing_line: Private first; protocol not person; invite questions in training.

choices.label: Speak privately and understand their concern; then reinforce the standard.

steps.step: Private conversation: understand concern; address barriers or clarify why protocol matters.
Reinforce standard; explain the why and evidence; acknowledge change is hard.

leader_lines: What's your concern? I want to hear it.
Here's why this protocol matters—and the standard is non-negotiable.
questions: How do we get buy-in for new protocols?
scripts.closing_line: Explain why and evidence; acknowledge change is hard; standard clear.

choices.label: Delay the implementation until they're on board.

steps.step: Never delay safety-critical protocol; use conversation to build understanding; set clear deadline.

leader_lines: We can't delay safety. We can talk through your concerns and set a clear deadline.
When can we delay vs not?
questions: What would help you get on board?
What's the latest we can roll out?
scripts.closing_line: No delay on safety; build understanding; clear deadline.

choices.label: Ask them to help refine the protocol and then roll it out together.

steps.step: Process input, not safety compromise; pilot their suggestions where safe; credit their contribution.

leader_lines: I want you to help refine how we roll this out—without watering down safety.
Involving resisters can turn them into champions.
questions: How do we involve without watering down safety?
scripts.closing_line: Process input only; pilot where safe; credit contribution.

system_prompts.nudge: Standards last longer when dignity is preserved.
system_prompts.mirror_call: Did you assert authority or preserve dignity?

outcomes.message: They may feel humiliated. Others may side with them; influence can drop.
reflection_questions: What would have changed with private-then-standard?
How do you reinforce without shaming?

outcomes.message: Dignity preserved and standard clear. They may become an ally for adoption.
reflection_questions: What would you do for the next protocol?

tsp.weekly_pulse_prompt: This week I reinforced standards with dignity. (1-5)
